feed.title: Duplicacy Releases
feed.subtitle: Self-hosted software releases generated by selfh.st

entry.title: New release for Duplicacy: Duplicacy Command Line Version 3.2.1
entry.content:
• Removed a false check that caused an initialization error with zstd-enabled storages: https://github.com/gilbertchen/duplicacy/pull/653 (thanks @gorbak25)
  • Allow two copy-compatible storages to have different compression levels: https://github.com/gilbertchen/duplicacy/commit/4e9d2c4cca7b4ebd394323fa154918da9bf2e939
  • Skip identical entries when listing chunks: https://github.com/gilbertchen/duplicacy/commit/d92b1734f476d7f67f176d7f853c7013baffb301
  • Upgraded Go version to 1.19.13

entry.title: New release for Duplicacy: Duplicacy Command Line Version 3.2.2
entry.content: • Save storj credentials in keychain/keyring after a storj storage has been successfully created: https://github.com/gilbertchen/duplicacy/commit/7bfc0e7d5114c448ae7c90c6cda06faccdf78eab

entry.title: New release for Duplicacy: Duplicacy Command Line Version 3.2.3
entry.content: • Upgrade storj.io/uplink to v1.12.1 to fix an 64 bit alignment issue: https://github.com/gilbertchen/duplicacy/commit/e99dfea048e0e42092835e9e57ee56dfbdb6184b

entry.title: New release for Duplicacy: Duplicacy Command Line Version 3.2.4
entry.content:
• Fixed a bug causing prune to repeatedly overwrite collection 1 in -collect-only mode
  • Remove incomplete_files when backup completes successfully
  • Do not save incomplete snapshots for dry run to avoid corrupting subsequent backups
  • Corrected zstd compression level name from "fast" to "fastest"
  • Save the list of verified chunks every 5 minutes for crash resilience
  • Don't add corrupt chunks to verified_chunks
  • Use a different API to find the id of a GCD drive by name for cases with more than 10 shared drives
  • Upgrade go to version 1.21.13

entry.title: New release for Duplicacy: Duplicacy Command Line Version 3.2.5
entry.content:
• Fixed bugs in OneDrive related to the handling of fossils: https://github.com/gilbertchen/duplicacy/commit/df76bd0a34241092a4f67155ebfb7c9b79d40dbe
  • Use regex in swift storage url parsing to allow a username to contain a @: https://github.com/gilbertchen/duplicacy/commit/065ae50868574404c502fb8b9508a2475d218337
